public class SignalMetadata
extends java.lang.Object

Specifies a signal value.

Method Detail

getSelFileLineNo

public int getSelFileLineNo()
Returns the file line number where this signal metadata was defined.

The purpose is to make it possible to give precise error information to the user.

Returns:

setSelFileLineNo

public void setSelFileLineNo(int lineNo)
Sets the file line number where this signal metadata was defined.

Used when the SignalMetadata definition is read from file. The purpose is to make it possible to output precise error information to the user.

getType

public SignalMetadata.SignalType getType()
Returns the signal type (Analog/Digital).

The meaning of type is if the signal value is a continuous analog value or a digital value that can be either true or false (1/0).

setType

public void setType(SignalMetadata.SignalType st)
Sets the signal type (Analog/Digital).

The meaning of type is if the signal value is a continuous analog value or a digital value that can be either true or false (1/0).

Returns the data type (float, int, etc.).

getLength

public int getLength()
Returns the number of elements of the given data type that this meta data object defines.

setLength

public void setLength(int length)
Sets the number of elements of the given data type that this meta data object defines.

getDataTypeAsOrdinal

public int getDataTypeAsOrdinal()
Returns the ordinal of the SignalMetadata.SignalDataType enumeration constant. This has only use if the SignalMetadata object is accessed from within native code through JNI.

Returns:
The ordinal of this enumeration constant.

setDataTypeAsOrdinal

public void setDataTypeAsOrdinal(int ordinal)

getDataflowDirection

public SignalMetadata.DataflowDirection getDataflowDirection()
Returns the data flow direction for this signal.

getPMSignalID

public java.lang.String getPMSignalID()
Returns the process model signal id.

This unique id identifies the signal for the process model adapter. This id has no meaning for the GIL framework. It is used solely by the PM-adapter.

getESSignalID

public java.lang.String getESSignalID()
Returns the external system signal id.

This unique id identifies the signal for the external system adapter. This id has no meaning for the GIL framework. It is used solely by the ES-adapter.

getDescription

public java.lang.String getDescription()
Returns a descriptive text for the signal.

getCustomAttributes

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getCustomAttributes()
Returns key-value pairs of custom attributes.

This is a set of arbitrary attributes that may be interpreted and used by either or all of the ES-adapter, PM-adapter and pipeline stages.

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
Returns a deep copy of this object.

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object

getBufferSize

public int getBufferSize()
Returns the necessary number of bytes a buffer must allocate to be able to hold signal data specified by this metadata object.

calcBufferSize

public static int calcBufferSize(SignalMetadata[] mds)
Calculates the necessary number of bytes a buffer must allocate to be able to hold signal data specified by the given signal metadata array.

Returns:
Requested number of bytes

getSignalsToExternalSystem

public static SignalMetadata[] getSignalsToExternalSystem(SignalMetadata[] allSignals)
Retrieves the subset of signals with a dataflow direction from the PM to the ES.

Parameters:
allSignals - The complete set of signal metadata objects whichever dataflow direction.
Returns:
The subset of signals with a dataflow direction from the process model to the external system.

getSignalsToProcessModel

public static SignalMetadata[] getSignalsToProcessModel(SignalMetadata[] allSignals)
Retrieves the subset of signals with a dataflow direction from the ES to the PM.

Parameters:
allSignals - The complete set of signal metadata objects whichever dataflow direction.
Returns:
The subset of signals with a dataflow direction from the external system to the process model.
